tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE Events (
    event_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name TEXT,
    event_date DATE,
    event_location TEXT,
    participant_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE Exhibitions (
    exhibition_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    exhibition_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    exhibition_date DATE NOT NULL,
    exhibition_location TEXT NOT NULL,
    sculptor_name TEXT NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE Events (
  event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  event_name VARCHAR(255),
  event_date DATE,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  organizer VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE Sculptures (
  sculpture_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sculpture_name VARCHAR(255),
  artist VARCHAR(255),
  material VARCHAR(255),
  year_created INT
)

CREATE TABLE Participants (
  participant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  participant_name VARCHAR(255),
  organization VARCHAR(255),
  event_id INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES Events(event_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Events (
    event_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    event_name VARCHAR(255),
    event_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    organizer VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE Exhibitions (
    exhibition_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    exhibition_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE Sculptures (
    sculpture_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sculpture_name VARCHAR(255),
    artist VARCHAR(255),
    material VARCHAR(255),
    year_created INT
)

CREATE TABLE Participants (
    participant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    participant_name VARCHAR(255),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
    role VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE Event_Participants (
    event_id INT,
    participant_id INT,
    PRIMARY KEY (event_id, participant_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (event_id) REFERENCES Events(event_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (participant_id) REFERENCES Participants(participant_id)
)
